title: Federal Aviation Administration weather program to improve aviation safety

organization.name: Federal Aviation Administration
organization.location: Washington D.C., District of Columbia, United States

abstract: The implementation of the National Airspace System (NAS) will improve safety services to aviation. These services include collision avoidance, improved landing systems and better weather data acquisition and dissemination. The program to improve the quality of weather information includes the following: Radar Remote Weather Display System; Flight Service Automation System; Automatic Weather Observation System; Center Weather Processor, and Next Generation Weather Radar Development.

organization.name: Federal Aviation Administration
